summary: Find new Wordwalls to learn new Dragon Shouts (11) and use Dragon Souls to unlock the new shouts that are used to fast travel to different locations in Skyrim. Works in both 1st and 3rd person just like vanilla shouts. Companions and horses travel with you. No DLCs required.
descriptionHtml:
Shout Travel
4Jan2014

Find new Wordwalls to learn new Dragon Shouts (11) and use Dragon Souls to unlock the new shouts that are used to fast travel to different locations in Skyrim. Works in both 1st and 3rd person just like vanilla shouts. Companions and horses travel with you. No DLCs required.


[img]http://static2.nexusmods.com/15/mods/110/images/44804-3-1382075144.jpg[/img]


Current Shout Locations
From anywhere (inside or outside) in Skyrim to;

Sky Haven Temple
High Hrothgar
Windhelm
Falkreath
Solitude
Morthal
Dawnstar
Markarth
Riften
Whiterun
Winterhold

You can Shout Travel as far away from your destination or get closer to your destination before you use your shout. You choose the type of immersion and justification of using the shouts the way you want.

NOTE: Go to Sky Haven Temple and find The Book of Travel.

REQUIRED MODS
None, not even any DLCs.
Just make sure that you have a legal version of Skyrim with all the updates.

Known Issues
The visual effect coming from the Wordwall and the actual dragon word don’t show up. This is a minor issue I will keep working on, but everything else in this mod works as indicated.
End of Known Issues

FAQ

Q. Can this mod be added or updated to my game at any time?
A. Yes, you can add or update this mod at any time during your game play.

Q. Where are the Wordwalls?
A. I will give you the first Wordwall location, but the others you will have to find. The pictures on the mod page should give you some clues as to their locations. All Wordwalls will be in the general area of their Shout Travel locations. The Sky Haven Temple Wordwall is outside in the training courtyard.

Q. Will my Character do the Voice or are these Silent Shouts?
A. Right now you only hear the shout audio effect. It's the effect you hear if you Whirlwind Sprint. In a future update I might add the code in the script to determine what race and gender the character is to use as the voice.

Q. I couldn’t learn the word from a Wordwall. I hear the Wordwall sound, but no word is learnt.
A. Sometimes this could happen. There are times when Bethesda’s script engine won’t start scripts, so use the following console commands for any word you want to learn. The Wordwall sound will still be heard if you use console commands to learn the word.

XX where XX is the location number in your load order.

For Winterhold - In the console, type the following; teachword xx006ADA
For Solitude - In the console, type the following; teachword xx005FC5
For Whiterun - In the console, type the following; teachword xx006ACF
For High Hrothgar - In the console, type the following; teachword xx002443
For Riften - In the console, type the following; teachword xx006561
For Sky Haven Temple - In the console, type the following; teachword xx002442
For Windhelm - In the console, type the following; teachword xx0054E9
For Falkreath - In the console, type the following; teachword xx005A56
For Dawnstar - In the console, type the following; teachword xx005FE0
For Markarth - In the console, type the following; teachword xx005FEE
For Morthal - In the console, type the following; teachword xx005FD4

End of FAQ


Skyrim Nexus link: http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/44804//?

Steam link: http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=186817961


Update History -

4Jan2014 – Added the Shout Words to the Form Table so that if a Wordwall didn’t work to give the player the word, the player could use console commands to get the word. A Dragon Soul is still required to unlock the word.
1Nov2013 – Added Windhelm, Falkreath, Solitude, Morthal, Dawnstar, Markarth, Riften, Whiterun, Winterhold, and The Book of Travel
18Oct2013 – Added High Hrothgar
17Oct2013 – Initial Release
author: ItsMeToo on Nexus and klcjr on Steam
